solution_line_template: Every donut costs him $.{cost_per_donut} because {cost_per_dozen_donuts} divided by {donuts_per_dozen} equals <<{cost_per_dozen_donuts}/{donuts_per_dozen}={cost_per_donut}>>{cost_per_donut}
So he makes $.{profit_per_donut} for every donut he sells because ${sell_price_per_donut} minus $.{cost_per_donut} equals {profit_per_donut}
He needs to sell {donuts_to_sell} donuts because {goal_money} divided by {profit_per_donut} equals <<{goal_money}/{profit_per_donut}={donuts_to_sell}>>{donuts_to_sell}.

He needs to buy and sell {dozens_to_buy_and_sell} dozen donuts because {donuts_to_sell} divided by {donuts_per_dozen} equals <<{donuts_to_sell}/{donuts_per_dozen}={dozens_to_buy_and_sell}>>{dozens_to_buy_and_sell}
